video_description: An in depth look at the Hannspree Hannspad running Honeycomb, featuring the hardware, os, browsing, applications, media and gaming capabilities of this budget Android tablet.
title: Hannspree Hannspad Review - Honeycomb ROM - Part 1

comments.text: Superb reviews with great information and demonstration. Well done﻿ :-)
comments.author: srvuk

comments.text:
A question if I﻿ may about battery life.

What kind of use against expectation have you found?
comments.author: srvuk

comments.text: You are looking to get on average around 8 hours. You can get more or less depending on how intensive your use is. Really suprised at the battery life considering﻿ the price of the tab.
comments.author: TheLynxboy

comments.text: where did you get yours? Is it the﻿ one from ebuyer?
comments.author: GodGift09

comments.text: I got mine from Misco, but it is the same model as the one at eBuyer.﻿
comments.author: TheLynxboy

comments.text: Thanks for the﻿ positive comments.
comments.author: TheLynxboy

comments.text: I'm ordering mine today from Ebuyer (looks like misco discontinued selling this﻿ pad...)
comments.author: GodGift09

comments.text:
Good honest review -﻿ thanks.

I have heard from someone that they had Flashback 7.1 ROM on theirs and after a week their pad is no good and won't even start. You heard anything like this ?
comments.author: JohnYoungPhotography

comments.text: Pretty certain that is an isolated case and more than likely something was done incorrectly when flashing the ROM. There is a detailed brick﻿ recovery guide over at Slatedroid should the worst ever happen.
comments.author: TheLynxboy

comments.text:
Great review! Thanks very much!
Just my luck, Ebuyer has now sold out.

Bollox! First the﻿ Touchpad and now the Hannspad!

comments.text: Head over to slatedroid and ask on the forums, it's difficult to say why your having issues, but there is a ton of information﻿ on there that will help you figure it out.

comments.text: Great review, have bought this tablet myself on ebay a couple of months ago. Still have the frogo os on﻿ it. Is it very differcult to change the os system. I'm a bit of a novice when coming to the tech of a product. Any advice would be great.

comments.text: I got the Market working without root!   And on stock rom. Everything works including logging into accounts﻿ and using gTalk!

comments.text:
does what work for hp touchpad?

You﻿ can actually install android if you like, then you get a dualboot system, meaning you can choose between webOS and android when starting the device.
